alert.note: Alert for Willamette National Forest (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 05 at 3:08AM PDT until September 06 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR DRY AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 608... The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for significantly unstable conditions, which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...In Oregon, Fire Weather Zone 608 Willamette National Forest. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 19 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower 80s. * HAINES...From 5 (moderate) to 6 (high). * WIND...Southwest 3 to 6 mph, but 6 to 10 mph near the Cascade crest. * IMPACTS...Conditions may be favorable for rapid spread on any new or existing fires. Extreme fire behavior is possible. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
